intro: Sanvitalia longepedunculata, commonly known as the long peduncled sanvitalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Sanvitalia longepedunculata is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
